main event: A single yellowish-gold colored, round object was observed in the sky over Cornerbrooke, Newfoundland on April 18, 1952.
interesting points: The object made a 135-degree turn and had a short trail or tail observed during the turn.
The object was estimated to be 3-4 inches in diameter and traveling at an estimated speed of 500 mph at an altitude of around 2,000 feet.
The object was observed for approximately 1 minute from a ground position by a newspaper janitor.
The witness, a 28-year-old man with no military experience, was considered to be in high esteem by his acquaintances.
The weather conditions were clear and calm with a temperature of 30Â°F at the time of the sighting.
